comments.text:
Actually, the Queen of England IS the head of state.  It's the head of the 
government that makes the decisions, in the UK's case, the Prime Minister.  
The US president makes the decisions because the US is a presidential 
republic, where the president is both heads of state and government.﻿

comments.author: Brian Tracey

comments.text:
We should not have republicans or democrats. If you look at polotics you 
will see a pattern, I will tell you it now in a short context

Rebublicans tend to work towards industry and want to find the more 
efficent way of getting stuff done, no matter what it takes

Democrats tend to try and make everyone happy and cared for, no matter the 
cost

Rebublicans are on one side of the spectrum while democrats are on the 
other. We can not fix the country by voting one side or the other, we have 
to vote in between.

Now some of you may say thats why we have both parties in offices all over 
the US so it makes up for it, BUT IT DOESNT! Think of it this way. I live 
in oregon where we have 2 major colleges. One has a football team called 
the ducks, and the other are the beavers. No need to say they dont really 
get along. If there was a foot ball party and only beavers fans were there 
then the party would be fine, people would have fun and go home happy. Same 
if it was just ducks.

But if both fans are are the same party, fights would breakout, arguments 
would go rampant, and no fun would be had.

Now think if there were people there that just liked oregon and cheered for 
both teams, thats what you call a platypus. No matter what the party is 
good if its platypuses.

I think you see where I am going. We need more people in polotics that are 
in between.﻿
comments.author: max radke

comments.text:

comments.text:
5:39 "Her not knowing that the Queen of England is not the Head of 
State..." Not only is she the Head of State of England, but that of the

Sarah Palin couldn't tell the difference, but nor do you. ﻿

comments.author: Denis Olivera

comments.text:
In another segment aired on September 30, Couric asked Palin about her 
taste in periodicals:

“ COURIC: And when it comes to establishing your world view, I was curious, 
what newspapers and magazines did you regularly read before you were tapped 
for this — to stay informed and to understand the world?
PALIN: I’ve read most of them again with a great appreciation for the 
press, for the media, coming f—

COURIC: But like which ones specifically? I’m curious that you—

PALIN: Um, all of 'em, any of 'em that, um, have, have been in front of me 
over all these years. Um, I have a va—

COURIC: Can you name a few?

PALIN: I have a vast variety of sources where we get our news too. Alaska 
isn't a foreign country, where, it's kind of suggested and it seems like, 
'Wow, how could you keep in touch with what the rest of Washington, D.C. 
may be thinking and doing when you live up there in Alaska?' Believe me, 
Alaska is like a microcosm of America.

The last time Couric said something about Sarah Palin was: This makes us 
all realize how close we were to be govern by an idiot!﻿

patiently sit down with her at the computer to fact check, prove false and 
dispel the latest wacky right wing accusations about how President Obama is 
destroying America she doesn't seem to care what the truth is. Very creepy, 
It's almost like she's been possessed by aliens that are controlling her 
mind like invasion of the body snatchers...﻿

comments.author: Jay J

comments.text:
Re: valor, I took it to mean that he did not serve in the military.
Re: Czars, there are some radicals in the bunch.
Re: radical associations, Bill Ayers and Jeremiah Wright. 
Re: the Civil War, I don't get her point.  Maybe that he is divisive not 
that he wants the black man to be placed into slavery.  I don't know.  This 
guy is stretching though.  Thinks if he's passionate enough he'll make his 
point.  That's no different than Michelle Bachmann or a Freshman on a 
debate team.  People that do not like Palin may eat it up, but he makes a 
weak argument.  ﻿

+TanzanianRoots well, head of government means that influence is almost 
non-important because you HAVE executive powers such as veto and tax levy

capability but doesn't have the power of government. the queen doesn't even 
have much influence as head of state.

comments.text:
Right ... It's a non-official title here in the US for government 
appointees.  It was official in Russia.
comments.author: Jay J

comments.text:
Tsar was an official title, the last one to hold it was tsar Nicholas II 
Autocrat of All Russia. It was the title for the king of Russia and does 
not mean whatever Palin thinks it means. But again she did think Africa was 
a country and couldn't even explain what a VP does yet ran for the office.
comments.author: mcaddicts

comments.text:
Czars or Tzars are not official titles.  People appointed under presidents 
that oversee policy.  Modern presidents have had such appointments since 
FDR.  Obama has had more and has been criticized for some of his choices.
comments.author: Jay J

comments.text:
She's talking about the nonsense of positions like drug czar, and whatever 
the hell the rest of them are.  Not sure when that business started, 
putting some high-level white man in a position of power and calling him a 
"czar."    Like the Drug Czar is supposed to oversee all the anti-drug law 
enforcement, etc., in the country.  I want to say it started under Reagan, 
maybe with William Bennett?  Can't remember anymore.

comments.text:
I like that, despite the professionalism usually displayed by the guys who 
run this show, sometimes it is too much for them and they simply react in a 
seemingly honest and transparent way to the reality they're discussing. I 
find this Cenk guy quite funny, and I obviously realize that his comments 
usually involve a great deal of sarcasm, but I like to see that in a video 
such as this one he just couldn't help himself and he described Sarah 
Palin's comments exactly for what they are: really really really moronic﻿
